block.p: Jennifer Mara Koen and Mark Joseph Horowitz were married last evening by Rabbi Jerome Davidson at the TriBeCa Rooftop, a party space in Manhattan.

The bride and the bridegroom, both 28, received graduate degrees from Harvard University, she an M.B.A. and he a J.D. The bride graduated from Cornell University, and the bridegroom from the University of Michigan.
Jennifer Mara Koen and Mark Joseph Horowitz were married last evening by Rabbi Jerome Davidson at the TriBeCa Rooftop, a party space in Manhattan.

The bride and the bridegroom, both 28, received graduate degrees from Harvard University, she an M.B.A. and he a J.D. The bride graduated from Cornell University, and the bridegroom from the University of Michigan.

Mrs. Koen-Horowitz is the director of worldwide marketing for the Concord watch line of the Movado Group in Woodcliff Lake, N.J. She is the daughter of Julie and Robert Koen of Great Neck, N.Y. Her father is a senior partner in the New York office of Akin, Gump, Strauss, Hauer & Feld, the Washington law firm. Her mother teaches dance and drama at the Community Nursery School and the Temple Beth-El Early Education Center, both in Great Neck.

Mr. Horowitz is an associate in the business and technology group at Brobeck, Phleger & Harrison, a New York law firm. He is the son of Roberta and Fred Horowitz of Livingston, N.J., and London. His mother is a nurse in the outpatient surgery department at Overlook Hospital in Summit, N.J. His father is a project executive for the Exxon Mobil Corporation in London.
